alert.note: Alert for Boone; Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Putnam; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 7:30PM EDT until July 02 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Cabell County in central West Virginia... West central Kanawha County in central West Virginia... Southwestern Putnam County in western West Virginia... Lincoln County in central West Virginia... Northwestern Logan County in southern West Virginia... Northeastern Wayne County in western West Virginia... Northwestern Boone County in central West Virginia... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 730 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over East Lynn Lake, or 7 miles southeast of Wayne, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Madison, Wayne, Hamlin, Beech Fork State Park, Hurricane, Barboursville, Milton, Chapmanville, Ranger, Ona, Culloden, Spurlockville, Harts, Gill, East Lynn Lake, Kiahsville, Julian, Teays Valley, Alum Creek and Tornado. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 24 and 39. Route 119 between mile markers 39 and 65. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Putnam; Wayne
